title: FLUFL and the Diamond Operator
shortDescription: PEP 401 introduced the <> 'diamond operator' as an April Fools' joke!
detailedDescription: PEP 401 was an April Fools' Day joke (4/01) that introduced the FLUFL (Friendly Language Uncle For Life) and reinstated the <> diamond operator for inequality. The PEP humorously claimed that != was a 'horrible, finger pain inducing mistake' and that <> should be the sole spelling for inequality. You can actually enable this with a special import!
examples: # The FLUFL (Friendly Language Uncle For Life)
# Now you can use <> instead of !=
# x <> y  # instead of x != y
# '!= is a horrible, finger pain inducing mistake'
